head.supplied: Dear Mr Hindman. ¶ ¶ I beg to send you one of my old pamphlets of which I have just a spare copy, and which may possibly be of some use to you. ¶ ¶ If you will oblige me with the regular loan of the...

div.p: RB MSS M34, Library, Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne.

M's surviving dated correspondence with Hyndman spans 1858-9. The run of the Gardeners’ chronicle (until 1874 Gardeners' chronicle and agricultural gazette) now in the library of the Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne commences with the volume for 1844. Dear Mr Hindman.
I beg to send you one of my old pamphlets of which I have just a spare copy, and which may possibly be of some use to you.
If you will oblige me with the regular loan of the Gardeners Chronicle, I should gladly bear half the expense, until I get my own copy, for which I have written now
